Connect with your Employment Collaborative!

Massachusetts has 6 regional employment collaboratives working with community providers and businesses to help them match job opportunities with qualified applicants with disabilities.
Learn more and connect

Want to build your provider organization’s employment capacity? We can help!

We support provider organizations through technical assistance in the areas of employment and community-based day supports. Our TA is customized to the needs of the provider.
Contact Cindy for more information

ICI can help you develop a qualified and skilled workforce ICI offers a range of training opportunities to help direct support professionals develop the skills and competencies needed to achieve great outcomes.
Learn more

Previous Next

We Believe

  • Everyone can work.
  • Everyone has the right to earn a living wage in a job of their choosing, based on their unique talents, gifts, skills, and interests.
  • Employment is a way for people to achieve their personal dreams of success, respect, control, and choice.
  • Having a job can be an important part of one’s self-identity and value in society today.
  • Everyone should be paid at least minimum wage.

See our current trainings

MPTE

The Massachusetts Partnership for Transition on to Employment (MPTE) is a five-year project to improve labor market participation on for youth and young adults served by the Massachusetts Department of Developmental Services (DDS).

Learn more>>

Current Trainings

Note: Trainees of "Introduction to Community Employment" can choose to do the online self-paced course (option 1) or the live webinar (option 2).

Jan 29, 2019
10:00 AM EST
Introduction to Community Employment: January 2019 (option 2)

Register in advance for this webinar. After registering, you will receive a confirmation email containing information about joining the webinar.

Online
Ongoing
Introduction to Community Employment (online) - Option 1

This course begins with an overview of community employment, including current social, political, and economic changes that are leading to expansion of opportunities for individuals with disabilities.

If you are working towards your ACRE Certificate or would prefer to have more time to review this content, register for this online course instead of the webinar.

Cost: Free
